claim: In the Codebase Community, the total bounty amount summed across posts whose titles contain the word "data" is 250.
extra_info: About data means the title contains 'data'; total bounty Amount refers to Sum(BountyAmount)
reasoning: The SUM of BountyAmount from the votes table, joined with posts whose Title contains 'data' (case-insensitive via LIKE '%data%'), equals 250, which matches the claim exactly.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: The `posts` table doesn't have a `BountyAmount` column. Let me check the `votes` table, which might contain bounty information.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE votes
(
    Id           INTEGER  not null
        primary key,
    PostId       INTEGER  null,
    VoteTypeId   INTEGER  null,
    CreationDate DATE null,
    UserId       INTEGER  null,
    BountyAmount INTEGER  null,
        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (UserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

        foreign key (PostId) references posts (Id)

content.text: The `BountyAmount` is in the `votes` table. Now let me query it.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT SUM(v.BountyAmount) FROM votes v JOIN posts p ON v.PostId = p.Id WHERE p.Title LIKE '%data%';"

content.text:
The query returns exactly 250, which matches the claim.
